result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:15 am cases 22CF726, 22CF957 called. Defendant Michael R. Bjerke in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Warrant is quashed, bond continues. A STC is scheduled on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:04 PM Cases called: 22CF726 & 22CF957. Defendant Michael R. Bjerke does not appear.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Michael R. Bjerke.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
State requests a warrant be ordered in both cases. Court orders a warrant; but it is stayed until noon on 10/24/22.

9:51 AM cases 22CF726, 22CF957 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael R. Bjerke in court with Attorney Katherine Cook. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Branch 1 for further scheduling.
